abstract.para: The fish number, species, lengths, weights, sex, and maturity of fish captured in Toolik Lake during the summers of 1986-1989.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Toolik Lake, at the Toolik Lake Research Station, arctic Alaska.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: Jul 91 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Julie Pallant DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Julie Pallant DATE: 4Oct91

para.literalLayout: The various species of fish were removed from Toolik Lake using experimental gill nets or hook and line gear. The type of gear is noted in the data file. The species, lengths, weights, recapture (if applies) and sex of each fish was recorded as well as the maturity and whether or not the stomach, gonads and/or otoliths were taken.

Notes: When using gill nets, the nets were in the water during the time noted in the "comments" column. Hook and line captures were usually measured, tagged, then released, although some sport fishing was encountered. These sport catches were measured and as much data was recorded as possible from the fish before they were eaten or iced by the fisherman.

Variable Variable descrip. Preces./Units Coded Missing (Y/N) Values SITE Site of measurement y DATE Date DDMMMYY n FISH # Fish number n blank TAG # Number on the tag (if tagged) n blank RETAG # Number on the tag (if recaptured) n blank FIN CLIP Some fish weren't tagged, but were n blank fin clipped instead. This number is the number of dorsal rays back from the most anterior one that got clipped ("8" means that the number 8 ray got clipped). SPECIES LT = lake trout n GR = grayling n RW = round whitefish n BU = burbot n LOCALITY Where the fish was caught n blank TL Total length mm n blank FL Fork length mm n blank SL Standard length mm n blank WT Weight mm n blank STOM Stomach taken? (y/n) n P1 Was pectoral fin taken? (y/n) n SCALES Were scales removed? (y/n) n OTO Otoliths removed? (y/n) n SEX Male or female n blank MATURE Mature or immature (y/n) n blank COMMENTS notes about the data n blank (12) CALCULATIONS Variable Formula
